items.TechManual: Common minerals such as iron, copper, aluminium, etc. which are important basic construction materials for most advanced races and cultures. Almost all items produced at factory complexes are at least partially made from metals.

Another type of basic construction material besides metals and hydrocarbons, basic elements are often associated with modern power sources and advanced chemical products. The designation covers common substances that are used in industrial processes, including fissionables such as uranium and plutonium as well as refined elements such as sodium, sulphur, oxygen and deuterium.

A catchall designation for common organic compounds that is not always accurate in a chemical sense. Hydrocarbons often take the form of coal, oil or natural gas but most advanced cultures have long since abandoned their use as fossil fuels. Instead, they are frequently used for biochemical products and for plastics, an important basic construction material like metals and basic elements.

Light alloys are a wide variety of processed metals like high-grade steel and alloys based around magnesium, titanium or tungsten, for example. They are more useful in production than more common metals and 1mu will do the same job as 2mu metals. They will be automatically substituted during production if no metals are available.

Complex compounds are processed basic elements, usually with improved power generating or power storing capabilities. As such they are more useful in production and 1mu will do the same job as 2mu basic elements. They will be automatically substituted during production if no basic elements are available.

Poly composites are hydrocarbons that have been processed into specialized synthetic materials and 1mu will do the same job as 2mu hydrocarbons. They will be automatically substituted during production if no hydrocarbons are available.

The resilience and strength of thorlium is added to more common construction materials to produce very efficient albeit expensive raw materials for the construction of standard items. During production, thorlium laced alloys will be automatically used if no metals or light alloys are available. 1mu will do the same job as 4mu metals or 2mu light alloys.

Pulac augmented compounds can make limited use of the unique properties of pulac to tap into subspace, yet without the danger of pulac burnout. As such they are useless for purposes requiring pure pulac but they are still useful for storing, handling or even generating power and 1mu will do the same job as 4mu basic elements or 2mu complex compounds for manufacturing purposes. They will be automatically substituted during production if no basic elements or complex compounds are available.

The result of advanced processing aimed at the production of highly specialized hydrocarbons for a variety of industrial purposes. They will be automatically substituted during production if no hydro carbons or poly composites are available. 1mu will do the same job as 4mu hydro carbons or 2mu poly composites.

The strong structures gained from combining common minerals with jacium allow for the production of very delicate mechanics as well as super-light yet strong casing. For production purposes, 1mu of jacium laced alloys will do the same job as 8mu metals, 4mu light alloys or 2mu thorlium laced alloys and they will be automatically substituted during production if none of the other substances are available.

With the unique power transformation properties of collidium, collidium augmented compounds can generate, store and handle energy even better than pulac augmented compounds. During production, 1mu will do the same job as 8mu basic elements, 4mu complex compounds or 2mu pulac augmented compounds. They will be automatically substituted during production if none of the other substances are available.

A very advanced form of processed hydrocarbons that have been bio-engineered to perform specific tasks. As such they are highly efficient for industrial purposes. 1mu will do the same job as 8mu hydrocarbons, 4mu poly composites or 2mu vat grown morph. They will be automatically substituted during production if none of the other substances are available.
Standard processing of thorlium is generally good enough for most uses, however refining and super compression are capable of quartering the mass required during production.

This dull greyish-black substance cannot be synthetisized, but it can be found as a naturally occurring mineral on some worlds. Only modern factories are able to process thorlium, as it has an incredible tensile strength and resilience to corrosion and damage. This makes it the perfect component for items that have to resist heavy punishment such as military armour, starship hulls and general heavy-duty mechanical gear.

This translucent crystal is white in its purest form but usually has a bright yellow tint from minor impurities that becomes orange, then red with decreasing quality. Pulac forms when subspace radiation slowly alters the molecular matrix of certain other minerals, a process thought to take billions of years. It cannot be manufactured synthetically. Because its crystalline structure is tuned to subspace radiation pulac can be used to detect subspace currents, which is vital to identify safe jump destinations for displacement drives or to receive subspace communication. Pulac can even be used to tap into subspace as an energy source but this usually burns out the crystals after some time. When exposed to hard radiation (like from weapons fire) pulac tends to burn out in an explosive discharge.

These are the elements from the 6th (lanthanide series) and 7th (actinide series) row in group 3 in the periodic system. They are metals with vaguely similar chemical properties and some quite fascinating uses in modern technology, hence are required in the production of various items. As their name implies they are very rare and difficult to obtain. Many rare earth elements can only be produced artificially because they are so unstable that they break up after fractions of a second. Those that have at least one stable isotope are not usually found in their pure form but have to be refined from so-called rare earths, rare minerals that tend to consist of several of these elements and isotopes at the same time which makes separation even more difficult. Some rare earth elements, like uranium and plutonium, are also considered basic construction materials (metals, light alloys, basic elements or complex compounds) because of their industrial uses.

Korondite is a naturally occuring ore that attenuates specific forms of radiation in a similar manner to lead. It has a very low specific heat capacity and as such is of no use as a shielding agent against high energy pulses. Its primary use is to dampen easily detected energy emissions. Korondite is a dull black, rather soft and very heavy metallic substance, believed to be some metal isotope. Because of its damping capability it has so far defied any attempts to analyze and classify it. Synthetisizing it is therefore considered impossible.

Strion can be extracted from its ore, a rocky substance with a characteristic green hue, on some worlds. It has a very complicated molecular structure that cannot be manufactured synthetically. Its molecules are huge and form perfect spheres (by molecular standards, at least). This makes it the ultimate lubricant on a molecular level to the point of boosting factory output in basic production by up to 20%. However, strion molecules are not very stable and are consumed by the factories. For maximum efficiency a factory will need 1mu of strion per week. A starbase will automatically use strion for basic production if it is available. Mass production lines have been optimized with other techniques and have no use for strion.

This term is usually associated with silver, gold and platinum, all of which have a good electrical conductivity combined with a high corrosion resistance. While required in the production of certain pieces of technology, precious metals are also much sought after for their value, and can be used with precious gems to manufacture jewellery.

Minerals that are highly valued for one reason or another are referred to as precious or, sometimes, semi-precious stones. Depending on their exact kind they have a range of industrial uses, some of them quite exotic, but are also commonly used to produce jewellery by combining them with precious metals.

Korondox gas is a rarefied version of korondite. Achieving this state is not simple although cases of it occurring in nature are not unknown. In its gaseous phase it has a few uses that cannot be achieved through standard means although more often than not it is simply used as a korondite substitute.

Jacium in its pure form is a brittle, light grey substance that can be found on some worlds. It has the ability to merge into the molecular structure of a number of other metallic or crystalline substances where it enhances their structural integrity. Jacium enhanced compounds are much harder than the original materials but tend to chip and break under stress rather than to bend. This makes them useful for the construction of strong lightweight support structures but woefully unsuitable for uses associated with shock absorption, i.e. armour.

Using large amounts of energy this dark blue or black mineral can be stimulated to release several forms of unusual radiation in the process. In its crystalline form (also known as dryzillium, which is virtually the same mineral) it can even oscillate and emit subspace signals that can be received with pulac or dryzillium crystals. This makes collidium vital for subspace manipulation, especially communication. Its energy conversion is sometimes put to good use as an energy sink and there is a range of other applications for the radiation transformation such as an emitter for scanners.

This unassuming light grey mineral has a highly complex molecular structure with unusual electrical conductivity characteristics, one being that its conductivity increases for a limited period of time as more electrons are channelled through its matrix. Environmental parameters such as temperature and magnetic fields have also been found to play into this process. It is thought that fibrillium requires a very long period of time to form a stable matrix because all attempts to produce it synthetically have failed. Fibrillium can be put to use in the production of fuzzy logic processors and artificial intelligence. Artificial intelligence always has an unpredictable element of uncertainity and is therefore unsuitable for most automated processes but surprisingly effective in some uses where ingenuity is called for.

A soft silvery substance that can be mined on some worlds. It is a metallic isotope that has had its molecular matrix altered by subspace radiation over billions of years which is why it cannot be made synthetically. Celesium can be used as a super conductor and has the ability to act as a resonator, boosting emf fields or even subspace emissions.
This form of collidium is produced through the careful use of ionic acid on pulac crystals. The process wastes a lot of pulac.

Impervium is a peculiar mineral that tests as completely inert to virtually all reactions. It has an incredibly complex chemical structure that relies on carbon in the allotrope of diamond. The mineral however is not as tough as diamond and can be easily smashed. The unlikely arrangement of the molecules within the matrix has lead certain geologists to suspect that the mineral is not naturally occurring, but has been processed from other minerals. To date no known used have been discovered for the mineral.

Used to extract minerals from stable ores. Very, very unstable. Research into synthetic dryzillium can be undertaken. A special action by a position owning this substance will add synthetic dryzillium to the knowledge archive.
Zionite is rare naturally occurring ore. It cannot be produced synthetically.
This extremely rare mineral releases huge quantities of energy in a blast of radiation when correctly stimulated. Moxa can not be manufactured.

This rare ore completely rewrites the rules of gravity. When subjectedto a carefully modulated energy field the local gravitational field is distorted and in some cases reversed. It is very difficult to control.

Matter, when subjected to intense pressures and strong magnetic fields can be compressed to such an extent that electrons no longer obey the exclusion principle. The uses for this material are still being researched. While it may be represented as 1mu, it is little more than a magnetic bottle with a single grain of degenerate matter.

Antimatter is the condensed version of antiparticles. This makes it suitable for industrial, military and naval use. While technically easier to make than degenerate matter, the major complications come with safe handling and storage of this substance when large masses are considered. Containment of large amount of this substance is difficult. Uses are still being researched but ammo is a clear option. Jacium laced alloys are the only known long term storage system.
This is little more than a nebulous soup of antileptons that have been collected through various means. These may be naturally occurring or generated through the use of large amounts of energy.

Patches represent a wild collection of generic spare parts, expendables and tools which are used up by maintenance complexes whenever maintenance works or repairs are performed on a starship. One mass unit of patches will either suffice to repair 10 points of hull damage or cover maintenance requirements for one ship hull modified by the type.

1 patch per hull will be used to increase current integrity to 125% or reduce hull damage by 12.5 depending on whether the ship is performing a maintenance or repair visit. A patch is actually a liquid suspension of nanites whcich are programmed to seek out fractures and breaks and fuse with them. This will repair the object.

1 patch per hull will be used to increase current integrity to 150% or reduce hull damage by 15 depending on whether the ship is performing a maintenance or repair visit. A patch is actually a liquid suspension of nanites whcich are programmed to seek out fractures and breaks and fuse with them. This will repair the object.
Paper thin, these are equivalent to those used in early pioneering rockets and shuttles. It is generally only used in ships far from danger zones.
These are little more than shells of aereated metals. This honeycomb structure gives little protection but is structurally suitable for freighters.
These are little more than shells of aereated metals. This honeycomb structure gives little protection but is structurally suitable for freighters.

Organic hulls are made out of polypeptide chains and are actually grown in special tanks to the specific requirements before assembly. They are much more flexible than standard hulls, making them more resilient to integrity losses. They are not as tough though making them more susceptible to damage.
Composed of laminate sheets of metals and thorlium with smaller internal regions and bulkheads, the hulls are both structurally strong and fairly resilient to damage.
Composed of laminate sheets of metals and thorlium with smaller internal regions and bulkheads, the hulls are both structurally strong and fairly resilient to damage.
Composed of laminate sheets of metals and thorlium with smaller internal regions and bulkheads, the hulls are both structurally strong and fairly resilient to damage.
Composed of laminate sheets of metals and thorlium with smaller internal regions and bulkheads, the hulls are both structurally strong and fairly resilient to damage.
Composed of non-metallic minerals which while rigid and strong tend to suffer from more from strain and stress than normal hulls although are more resilient to damage.

Organic hulls are made out of polypeptide chains and are actually grown in special tanks to the specific requirements before assembly. They are much more flexible than standard hulls, making them more resilient to integrity losses. They are not as tough though making them more susceptible to damage.

Organic hulls are made out of polypeptide chains and are actually grown in special tanks to the specific requirements before assembly. They are much more flexible than standard hulls, making them more resilient to integrity losses. They are not as tough though making them more susceptible to damage.
These are comprised of thick laminate plates covering a small space making the overall density high. Due to this, the overall resillience to both damage and stress is very high.
These are comprised of thick laminate plates covering a small space making the overall density high. Due to this, the overall resillience to both damage and stress is very high.

Organic hulls are made out of polypeptide chains and are actually grown in special tanks to the specific requirements before assembly. They are much more flexible than standard hulls, making them more resilient to integrity losses. They are not as tough though making them more susceptible to damage.

Platform hulls do not need to perform as many functions as those destined to be incorporated into ships. As such they can be designed to contain a larger volume. These generate 10 deflector factors per platform hull.

Stealth platform hulls use little in the way of integral defence. This allows them to have a higher cargo space or more importantly hold the same scanning equipment in only half the hulls of a standard platform. These do not generate deflector factors.

As the name suggests these are effectively chunks of rock that have been customised for the purpose of using them for plaforms. They rarely have much space when considered in proportion to their actual size. These generate 2 deflector factors per platform hull.
These are invariably used where space is a premium such as warships. They are resilient to damage but this is on account of the large amounts of thorlium and jacium that go into their construction.
A larger version of the Bunk. It performs exactly as regular quarters, but has good armour protection.
The bridge is the main command station of a ship. While a ship can be flown without one such as after a battle, the efficiency of all operations is reduced.

The bridge is the main command station of a ship. While a ship can be flown without one such as after a battle, the efficiency of all operations is reduced. This is primarily built only into warships as while it is only as good as a normal bridge, it is heavily armoured ensuring that it is not easily crippled during combat. The large amounts of thorlium in its construction means that it is luxury often spared on trade ships.
A smaller version of a normal bridge, it is much less efficient but due to its size has a much lower chance of being hit during combat.
Sensors are used to scan other positions. Having more than one Sensor can increase the amount of information received by a scan. They are also used for scanning for minerals.
Sensors are used to scan other positions. Having more than one Sensor can increase the amount of information received by a scan. They are also used for scanning for minerals.
Sensors are used to scan other positions. Having more than one Sensor can increase the amount of information received by a scan. They are also used for scanning for minerals.
Sensors are used to scan other positions. Having more than one Sensor can increase the amount of information received by a scan. They are also used for scanning for minerals.

These are state of the art targeting computers. They are used in space battle to increase the chances of hitting the enemy. With a large number of computers on line your weapon accuracy can be increased.

These are state of the art targeting computers. They are used in space battle to increase the chances of hitting the enemy. With a large number of computers on line your weapon accuracy can be increased.

These are state of the art targeting computers. They are used in space battle to increase the chances of hitting the enemy. With a large number of computers on line your weapon accuracy can be increased.
These are used to prevent a the contents of a position from being scanned. The greater the number of jammers the greater the dampening field. They do not hide the position.
These decrease the scanned surface area of a ship during combat down to a maximum of 50%. By giving a false surface area, they decrease the accuracy of incoming fire.

Shield produce a field around the position that absorbs energy. The quantity of the shield factors determines the thickness of the field. The thicker the field, the greater the energy that can be absorbed per blast. Ship's shields be automatically recharged to maximum during repair visits to maintenance complexes. Crew factors are only required to run shields in a ship.

Shield produce a field around the position that absorbs energy. The quantity of the shield factors determines the thickness of the field. The thicker the field, the greater the energy that can be absorbed per blast. Crew factors are only required to run shields in a ship.

Shield produce a field around the position that absorbs energy. The quantity of the shield factors determines the thickness of the field. The thicker the field, the greater the energy that can be absorbed per blast. Crew factors are only required to run shields in a ship.

These restore shield factors. They will only replenish shield factors to the maximum. They will restore their output per battle round or four times this amount per day without combat. A ship without generators will only have the shields recharged during repair visits to maintenance complexes.
These restore shield factors. They will only replenish shield factors to the maximum. They will restore their output per battle round or four times this amount per day without combat.
These restore shield factors. They will only replenish shield factors to the maximum. They will restore their output per battle round or four times this amount per day without combat.

The scintillator combines the electrostatic field of a weak shield with the reflective properties of a constantly moving mass of fine highly polished precious metal dust particles. They reduce the damage of any incoming beam weapons.
Cryopods are chambers were life forms can be held in stasis during space travel. Without the need for living quarters, larger quantities of life forms can be transported.

Quarters are used to house life forms. They include recreational, sanitary, sleeping and dining regions. They can also be used to move other forms of life. The plusher quarters can readily be turned into sanitary facilities for the hauling of livestock.

A yet smaller version of the Cargo Bay to fill the odd 5mu that remain empty on some designs. As it will require 1 crew factor it is very inefficient and will never see heavy use, but it can still be useful.
These do not have any life support at all. They are little more than open regions with mechanical shunting system to shifting ores.
These have minimal life support preventing fragile items from being exposed to the colds of space. They also have automated cargo handling systems.
These are designed to prevent ammo hit during a space battle from destroying the rest of the position. They have heavy armour and dampening fields around them.
This is used for prospecting. The output is the number of TU's required to prospect.
This is used for prospecting. The output is the number of TU's required to prospect.
This is used for prospecting. The output is the number of TU's required to prospect.
This is used for prospecting. The output is the number of TU's required to prospect.
They are the fastest micro-jump engines but generate a very small field with sheering stresses. These can only be used by ships with heavy hulls as these occupy the smallest volume.
These produce a moderately sized field and as such can only be used by ships with heavy and normal sized hulls.
These are the standard drives. They cannot be used by ships with xlight hulls.
These can be used by any ships. They are slow to produce a micro-jump field due to their small size. They can be used by any ships.
They also allow a ship to move into, or out of, orbit and to land upon planets. They are also used to in combat. The larger the total factors to mass, the faster the ship.
They also allow a ship to move into, or out of, orbit and to land upon planets. They are also used to in combat. The larger the total factors to mass, the faster the ship.
They also allow a ship to move into, or out of, orbit and to land upon planets. They are also used to in combat. The larger the total factors to mass, the faster the ship.

They also allow a ship to move into, or out of, orbit and to land upon planets. They are also used to in combat. The larger the total factors to mass, the faster the ship. Thorlium and jacium are used to protect against extended burn while collidium give the quick burst for manoeuvering.

These produce rapid impulses which can spin a ship and rapidly alter direction although cannot sustain long impulses. They are only used in combat. The greater the overall factors to ship mass, the greater the speed.

These produce rapid impulses which can spin a ship and rapidly alter direction although cannot sustain long impulses. They are only used in combat. The greater the overall factors to ship mass, the greater the speed.

They also allow a ship to move into, or out of, orbit and to land upon planets. They work by producing constant impulse. They are not used in combat. The larger the total factors to mass, the faster the ship.

They also allow a ship to move into, or out of, orbit and to land upon planets. They work by producing constant impulse. They are not used in combat. The larger the total factors to mass, the faster the ship.

They also allow a ship to move into, or out of, orbit and to land upon planets. They work by producing constant impulse. They are not used in combat. The larger the total factors to mass, the faster the ship. Thorlium and jacium are used to improve resistence to extended burn.

Built into the EEM start-up courier ship - they cannot be removed or researched.
Output is the TU's required to make a jump. All JE's have an range of 4 jumps.
Output is the TU's required to make a jump. All JE's have an range of 4 jumps.
Output is the TU's required to make a jump. All JE's have an range of 4 jumps.
Output is the TU's required to make a jump. All JE's have an range of 4 jumps.
Output is the TU's required to make a jump. All JE's have an range of 4 jumps. Max ship size is 50 hulls.

TechManual.value: Larger cargo capacity than a cargo bay, same crew factors.
An entire level of the ship is geared up to holding cargo.

items.TechManual: These do not have any life support at all. They are little more than open regions with mechanical shunting system to shifting ores. They are much larger versions of the ore bay but require the same crew factors.

These do not have any life support at all. They are little more than open regions with mechanical shunting system to shifting ores. They are much larger versions of the ore bay but require the same crew factors.

TechManual.value: These scan everything entering the ship for possible diseases.

items.TechManual: Cryobays are chambers were life forms can be held in stasis during space travel. Without the need for living quarters, larger quantities of life forms can be transported.
Cryochambers are sections were life forms can be held in stasis during space travel. Without the need for living quarters, larger quantities of life forms can be transported.
The device projects a resonance field from the hull of the ship, stabilising the wormhole around the ship. This reduces the stress on the ship, reducing integrity losses.

TechManual.value: Output is the integrity loss reduction measured as a percent.
Output is the integrity loss reduction measured as a percent.

items.TechManual: It generates a field that reduces the ship's inertia allowing it to dodge. The output is the bonus to manoeuvring at 50 hulls, dropping by half at 100 hulls.

TechManual.value: Battle sensors are armoured making them suitable in combat.

items.TechManual: This weapon is used in space battle. Each launcher can fire one missile per round (assuming the missiles are available).
This weapon is used in space battle. Each launcher can fire one missile per round (assuming the missiles are available).

This weapon is used in space battle. Each launcher can fire one missile per round (assuming the missiles are available). As well as strengthening the launcher allowing missiles to be fired at higher thrusts, advances in targeting through the addition of fibrillium based interfaced have been added.
These are used as ammunition for the space battle missile launcher.
These are used as ammunition for the space battle missile launcher. They are faster than normal missiles and rely on this to produce energy for the explosion.
Launches intercepting missiles at space fighters and other missiles.
Fired by phalanx launchers. They are primarily sensors on a fast booster. Contact with the target is enough to destroy them both. They are not effective against other things.

Fired by phalanx launchers. They are primarily sensors on a fast booster. Contact with the target is enough to destroy them both. They are not effective against other things. Advanced missiles have much better sensors allowing them to pin-point weaknesses in the target.
Low power lasers that are used to blind missiles and space fighters making them ineffective. They are not of any use against more sophisticated sensors used by ships and starbases.
Low power lasers that are used to blind missiles and space fighters making them ineffective. They are not of any use against more sophisticated sensors used by ships and starbases.

TechManual.value: Does exactly as its name implies!

items.TechManual: The standard torpedo is self propelled and is capable of tracking its target in order to inflict considerable amounts of damage. It is not effected by scintillators. While torpedoes can be launched from a stationary position against another stationary position, they are designed to launch from a moving position. As such they suffer greatly (-12 ACC) if launched against targets that have a 1g-acceleration advantage. As tractor beam cannot reduce 'jitter' in a target, even one that is pinned through the use of tractor beams still counts its combat speed for the purposes of torpedoes.

The high yield torpedo is self propelled and is capable of tracking its target in order to inflict considerable amounts of damage. Due to the large explosion radius, it is less effective against heavy armour. It is not effected by scintillators. While torpedoes can be launched from a stationary position against another stationary position, they are designed to launch from a moving position. As such they suffer greatly (-12 ACC) if launched against targets that have a 1g-acceleration advantage. As tractor beam cannot reduce 'jitter' in a target, even one that is pinned through the use of tractor beams still counts its combat speed for the purposes of torpedoes.

The plasma torpedo is self propelled and is capable of tracking its target in order to inflict considerable amounts of damage. It is not effected by scintillators. While torpedoes can be launched from a stationary position against another stationary position, they are designed to launch from a moving position. As such they suffer greatly (-12 ACC) if launched against targets that have a 1g-acceleration advantage. As tractor beam cannot reduce 'jitter' in a target, even one that is pinned through the use of tractor beams still counts its combat speed for the purposes of torpedoes.

The plasma torpedo is self propelled and is capable of tracking its target in order to inflict considerable amounts of damage. It is not effected by scintillators. While torpedoes can be launched from a stationary position against another stationary position, they are designed to launch from a moving position. As such they suffer greatly (-12 ACC) if launched against targets that have a 1g-acceleration advantage. As tractor beam cannot reduce 'jitter' in a target, even one that is pinned through the use of tractor beams still counts its combat speed for the purposes of torpedoes.

The proximity torpedo is self propelled and is capable of tracking its target. It explodes when within its considerable range although it generally only effective against weak hulls. It is not effected by scintillators. While torpedoes can be launched from a stationary position against another stationary position, they are designed to launch from a moving position. As such they suffer greatly (-12 ACC) if launched against targets that have a 1g-acceleration advantage. As tractor beam cannot reduce 'jitter' in a target, even one that is pinned through the use of tractor beams still counts its combat speed for the purposes of torpedoes.
This is a specialised bay for the storage, rapid launch of space fighters and their control during combat. Insufficient bays to cover fighters due to damage will cause a loss of figthers.
This is a specialised bay for the storage, rapid launch of space fighters and their control during combat. Insufficient bays to cover fighters due to damage will cause a loss of figthers.
This is a specialised bay for the storage, rapid launch of space fighters and their control during combat. Insufficient bays to cover fighters due to damage will cause a loss of figthers.
These are fast and sleek but with little high powered weaponry. These run cover for bombers and space figthers as well as protecting the position.
These run cover for space fighters and bombers as well as attack enemy positions in close combat.
These run cover for space fighters and bombers as well as attack enemy positions in close combat.

TechManual.value: These are slow, having sacrificed thrust for weaponry.

items.TechManual: These are notoriously inaccurate due to the lack of guidance once the projectile has been fired. They are best used against stationary masses or by positions with very good targetting bonuses. They are indirect weaponry. This allows them to be used against ground based positions without being targeted by line-of-sight weapons. In order for ships to take advantage of this, they should not carry line-of-sight weapons such as beam weapons.

It is found that more energetic minerals such as celesium are unsuitable for this use.

This armour piercing (AP) round is composed of a super-conducting core that allows the round to be hyper accelerated inside the rail gun barrel. The effect is to punch through armour, however there is no explosive component so the damage is reduced.
This high explosive 'swash head' (HESH) round is designed to pack more punch that the AP round while still inflicting heavy damage on internal components.

This is the most primitive form of energy weapon. The basic technology is widely available and after years of research, this is now at the technological limits and as such larger versions of this weapon cannot be constructed.
The classic beam weapon. The weapon is efficient and has a high damage to mass ratio.
The classic beam weapon. It is not as efficient as smaller versions as it has sacrificed field integrity within the beam generation chamber for increased output energy.

Based on photon gun technology, this weapon has a finer beam. Higher penetration, lower blast radius make it especially effective against armour, scintillators and shields. Larger versions have also lower damage to mass ratios.
The output of the tractor beam directly counters the thrust output of the targeted ship. If the total tractor output against a ship is greater than its thrust, the ship will be held stationary.

The output of the tractor beam directly counters the thrust output of the targeted ship. If the total tractor output against a ship is greater than its thrust, the ship will be held stationary. Higher mk versions of the tractor beam use collidium in order to increase the frequency of tractor waves while maintaining stability in the overall field.

This utilises tractor beam technology to inflict sheering pulses of energy on the intended target.

Improves the effectiveness of stealth and korondite plates. The output is the reduction % of the number of plates required to give the same sensor profile, e.g. output 10 means that a ship with 90% of its maximum plates will still have a profile as though it has 100% of its plates. A ship with an amplifier and full plates will have a lower profile. Amplifiers cause plates to decay to the point where the ship will have the same profile as it would normally have without the amplifier.
This will cloak a ship or with a surface area up to 63. This will make it impossible to scan.
This will cloak a ship with a surface area up to 83. This will make it impossible to scan.
This will cloak a ship with a surface area up to 100. This will make it impossible to scan.
This will cloak a ship with a surface area up to 116. This will make it impossible to scan.
Reduces time to lift into orbit from 5 times manoeuvre speed to 2 times.

TechManual.value: Reduces time to land from 5 times manoeuvre to 2 times.

items.TechManual: Allows landing on and taking off from high G worlds. Landing time is increased by difference in world and ship G multiplied by landing time.
This will cloak a ship with a surface area up to 131. This will make it impossible to scan.
This will cloak a ship with a surface area up to 145. This will make it impossible to scan.

This luxury ship's cabin has all the requirements for ambassadors and royalty to travel in style. Normally only one or two would be installed in an ambassadorial ship - the entourage would be expected to rough it in quarters with the rest of the crew.
This module plugs into all the cargo sections of the ship. The effect is to reduce the decay rate of perishable items. The output is the reduction in decay.

These require delicate antennae to extend out in all directions in order to create the maximum baseline but as a consequence cannot be directed. This makes them useless at detecting anything other than mineral composition of planetary surfaces.

These require delicate antennae to extend out in all directions in order to create the maximum baseline but as a consequence cannot be directed. This makes them useless at detecting anything other than mineral composition of planetary surfaces.

These are used by platforms in order to improve passive scans. They sweep out the entire orbital quadrant for ISR flux. This will only highlight anomalies, i.e. increase the chance of performing a scan. It does not in any way increase the chance of a successful scan as this is dependent on sensor power of the platform and sensor profile of the target. Sensor nets are therefore used in conjunction with sensors. In order to guarantee a scan, 25 sensor nets are required in orbital 5, 100 in orbital 10 and 225 in orbital 15.

The teleportor can be used to transport any item that can lock onto from inside the current system to its current location.

Rock structural modules fashioned from natural rock strata are heavy. As such they are unsuitable for transportation. They are normally considered natural resources used in cave construction on account of their relatively low tensile strength. Typically, they are most produced by resource complexes from planetary rock rather than through factory production. NB. Certain natural plants are exploited for timber that can be fashioned into structural modules. As modern materials are much lighter than natural ones, timber modules are generally classified as rock structural modules rather than structural modules. This is simply due to the mass of timber that is required to produce a module.

Not so much a module as a hole in the ground or natural rock face that can be accomodated as part of a structure. It is fixed and can only be used where it was found. It has negligible inherent mass and defense as it is not actively part of the base until incorporated into a structure.

While still requiring a large amount of minerals, the reinforced structural module is in many ways a lighter version of the rock structural module. It is essentially a lot of concrete with thorlium strengthening mesh.

TechManual.value: Used in rapidly upgrading civilian infrastructure.
Used in rapidly upgrading civilian infrastructure.

items.TechManual: Cheap and resilient to most weather conditions these are rolled out as part of infrastructure. They have integrated solar power collection and storage for lighting, heating and can supply local demands.

These are bolted onto ships during construction. The number of plates that can be used is dependent on the hull type of the ship. Heavier hulls can use more plates and therefore have better protection. They provide considerable amounts of protection against nearly all attacks.

This is a standard human. Civilians have no special qualities. Giving them weapons does not make them soldiers or heroes! They are generally obnoxius.

While they may work for the governor, they are not particularly loyal. Giving them weapons does not make them soldiers or heroes! They tend to constantly moan how horrible their jobs are. They work for 50 hours per week (based on the standard week of 5 days, each 45 hours long).
Slave can be used to work in complexes but must be supervised by guards and security. They can only be used by certain cultures.
These are bad-uns. A nice chat will not turn them into productive people.
These are generally only loyal as long as things are going well. They will defect in the event of surrender.
These are specifically trained in the use of all vehicles. Crew factors are reduced for the purposes of using alien technology. They are considered loyal to the owning position.

They have been trained in both weaponry and the in the use of vehicles. They are generally all round troops. They are best used on warships where space is a premium, but boarding is a risk. Crew factors are reduced for the purposes of using alien technology.

While they may work for the governor, they are not particularly loyal. Giving them weapons does not make them soldiers or heroes! This is a small lizard that is relatively intelligent and farms the local region from artificial hills. They produce excess foods and as such improve the infrastructure of the planet. Raising them outside their natural telepathic environment requires special procedures.
These are used as working animals rather than pets. Their tough coats and above animal intelligence allows them to be trained to perform a number of tasks.
The small creatures produce a number of useful resources when shipped as breeding stock.
These nearly mindless animals can provide the natives of a world with renewable source of planetary commerce and as such improve the infrastructure of the world.
The falconian goose bears almost no resemblance to the old Earth namesake. That is the power of first contact. These creatures are generally used as breeding stock by native populations.
This covers a range of domesticate creatures genetically enhanced over centuries by kastorian farmers.
Sentries have high security factors making them ideal for controlling slaves.

Slave can be used to work in complexes but must be supervised by guards and security. They can only be used by certain cultures. Native slaves are taken from indigenous life forms that are sufficiently developed to work on supervised projects but could not be given the responsibilities of normal employees. If freed they will return to being unemployable natives.

Native Employee, as with Naplian Employee is actually the generic name for aliens indigenous to the Peripheries with the capability of working in a starbase. The are however more primitive than the Naplians. Naplians invariably covers species of sentient aliens with the technological capability of interplanetary flight (even if they do not do so). Natives is a step below this level. This is reflected in their reduced work hours. They work for 30 hours per week (based on the standard week of 5 days, each 45 hours long). They can however be paid less if others are.
They should not be removed from their homeworld.
These are natives that are simply not geared for war. They hurl rocks, panic and flee if charged and are generally fodder.

This is an typical alien civilian with an understanding of the use of modern technology. They have no defined species, meaning that they may be all shapes and sizes from any one many different worlds.
Poorly equipped and poorly motivated - they will go into battle largely to prevent being eaten for cowardice.

Monks are almost exclusively human athough need not be. They have embraced Religious teachings and will work relentlessly in the cause, accepting their fate in this life for a better one in the hereafter. They work for 50 hours per week (based on the standard week of 5 days, each 45 hours long).
They spend most of the time concerned with staying alive. They are generally primative. They cannot normally be taken off world without some education, raising them to naplian status.

They are generally concerned with protecting their primitive settlements. They are generally spear-chucking, superstitious xenophobes. They cannot be trained at all (Iat least it is not worth the exhaustive use of techs to do so). Note that they can only be used on the world where they were found. They may be downgraded to natives if they are within a starbase on an alien world.

These highly advanced pieces of technology are self aware machines that are capable of working tirelessy although do need to recharge. They work for 200 hours per week (based on the standard week of 5 days, each 45 hours long).
Mindless alien creatures that need complete supervision. GM Note - these creatures can turn on their owners after the onset of combat.
Demons are intelligent aliens with a volatile temperement and vicious attitude. Certain captains employ them although a close eye has to be kept on them.
The bendians are enthusiastic workers and rarely quibble if underpaid (as long as everybody else is).

Militia are technologically advanced people that come to the aid of a faction in a time of crisis. They are inferior to mercenaries but better than native troops due to access to superior weapons. For convenience they do not have a race although it is implied that they are appropriate to the situation. It is also understood that they will be sacked after the event. The referee reserves the right to remove them from any position where their presence is considered anomalous.

TechManual.value: This officer cannot leave this vessel.

items.TechManual: This is a criminal that has agreed to use labour to pay of their debts to society. As they have greater freedom than slaves, they also do less work.

This is a Krell that has lost out in the natural dominance hierarchy dealings of the Krell species, and is in fact the most common natural state for a Krell adult outside the technically advanced enclaves. Any small grouping of subjugated Krell must be continually dominated to obtain any productive work whatsoever, and where the dominance is lax, groups will naturally band together to violently overthrow the subjugating force.
This is a criminal that has agreed to use labour to pay of their debts to society. As they have greater freedom than slaves, they also do less work.
